quotes.quote: We build our computer (systems) the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, on top of ruins.
The best thing about a boolean is even if you are wrong, you are only off by a bit.
If it's a good idea, go ahead and do it. It's much easier to apologize than it is to get permission.
The cityâ€™s central computer told you?  R2D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer!
I have always wished for my computer to be as easy to use as my telephone; my wish has come true because I can no longer figure out how to use my telephone.
Understand well as I may, my comprehension can only be an infinitesimal fraction of all I want to understand.
